newsitem.title: GERMANY: Toepfer maintains 1996 German grain crop estimate.
newsitem.headline: Toepfer maintains 1996 German grain crop estimate.

text.p: Germany's 1996 grain crop will be above 40 million tonnes compared with 39.9 million last year, grain trader Alfred Toepfer said in its latest monthly newsletter.
Toepfer last month gave a precise 40.6 million tonnes estimate.
Today's comments said the rise over 1995 would be more or less pronounced, but a precise figure was not given.
Harvesting was one or two weeks late and disrupted by rain in central and southern regions while the north was too dry, Toepfer said.
Cold temperatures were delaying ripening but yields looked better than expected.
Wheat and rye crops were of good quality but falling numbers, which measure baking qualities, looked significantly lower than last year, Toepfer said.
